entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French confesser, from confés having confessed, from Latin confessus, past participle of confitēri to confess, from com- + fatēri to confess; akin to Latin fari to speak ban

def.dt: :to tell or make known (as something wrong or damaging to oneself) :admit he confessed his guilt
:to acknowledge (sin) to God or to a priest
:to declare faith in or adherence to :profess
:to unburden one's sins or the state of one's conscience to God or to a priest
